text: hello this is chef john from food
whooshes calmly the pecan or pecan and
apricot stuffing / dressing you need it
depends so let me show you how to put
this together I'm gonna use a sourdough
loaf which I think gives dressing a
really nice flavor because it's a little
tangy and the other ingredients are on
the sweet side so it's a nice balance so
you're gonna tear that in small pieces
you can cut it if you want but if you
cut it you don't get as many nooks and
crannies and it's not as rough and
irregular which I think works good for
dressing by the way where I learned that
technique the park the people who feed
the pigeons in the ducts fabulous
technique go check them out
alright we're gonna pop that in a
275-degree oven until they're crisp and
dry it's gonna take about 20 minutes a
half hour
you don't wanna brown them you just want
to dry them out so they're crisp in the
meantime we're gonna get our aromatic
vegetables ready that is 1 onion diced
and about 2 ribs of celery diced we're
gonna add that to a saute pan on medium
low alright not too hot we're gonna melt
the butter that's 1/2 a stick of butter
I'm gonna add a teaspoon of salt and
we're gonna slowly braised those
vegetables in the butter this is the
secret to stuffing nice buttery aromatic
vegetables so that's gonna go about 10
minutes all together medium-low we don't
a brown them I'm gonna add a teaspoon of
herb de Provence okay and by the way her
de Provence is just like a almost like
an Italian herb mix it's got a little
lavender in there if you can't find that
just use an Italian or mix it's got the
thyme the rosemary the marjoram and so
forth that'll be fine and a teaspoon of
dry rubbed sage all right so the herbs
are in we're just gonna let that cook
for another couple minutes while I dice
my apricot I have 4 ounces of dried
pitted apricots so just go ahead and
dice those up alright nice and small who
want this to distribute throughout the
dressing I'm gonna add those to the hot
butter and I'm just gonna turn that off
alright stir them in turn off the heat
and just let them sit in that hot butter
with the vegetables while you prepare
the other things and that's just gonna
help flavor the butter it's gonna wake
up the flavors in the apricots a little
and it's going to be beautiful we're
gonna take a cup of pecan halves chop it
up
my bread is now ready it's crisp it's
dry but it's not brown if it's a little
golden that's okay but you don't want a
dark brown all right throw that in a
bowl add your pecans add your aromatic
vegetable apricot mixture we're gonna
put in a few grinds of fresh black
pepper to taste of course
all right give that a little toss and
then the wet ingredients I'm going to do
2 cups of a nice low-sodium organic
free-range chicken broth you use
whatever one you want I'm going to put a
cup of that in and mix it up and once
that's absorbed I'm going to add the
other cup and mix it up now why didn't I
add both at one time you know that's a
great question I really have no idea you
probably can that's just how I do it
though so you know follow me or do it
your own way I don't care I'm gonna add
one beaten egg are you gonna mix the egg
in well and when that's all mixed we're
gonna put it in a buttered casserole
dish now this is an eleven by fourteen I
like crispy top on my stuffing and the
bigger pan you use the crispy or the top
will get because it'll be flatter you
can pile this all up in a nine by you
know thirteen regular casserole dish if
you want it'll fit but it just will be
thicker and it won't have as big a you
know surface area by the way do not pack
it down if you pack it down it'll be
much denser but I like to just scatter
mine just give it a little light tapping
with the tip of the spatula so I got
lots of nooks and crannies look at the
nooks and look at the crannies check it
out all right it's gonna go in the oven
350 until the top is browned and it's
heated through it takes about a half
hour 35 minutes and that's done it is so
delicious so that is a great all-purpose
dressing the sweet and the sour from the
apricots the crunchy nutty pecans butter
that delicious sourdough butter of
course it's great with Thanksgiving but
here I served it with a pork chop it's
great with a prime rib of beef chicken
quail duck goose
you know any other bird you can name so
anyway there's an all-purpose easy
dressing slash stuffing and what's the
difference if you cook it like that is
dressing if you just stuff it in the

right so give that a try go to the

and as always enjoy
